entry.title: Revert "Improve SharedImageFactory with GrContextType::kNone"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 530c1a753fadea628530793485b46bb2fcb446b0.



Reason for revert: Fails Android WebView tests on some devices.



Original change's description:

> Improve SharedImageFactory with GrContextType::kNone

>

> When SharedImageFactory is initialized with kNone context type GPU

> SharedImageBackings aren't used outside of swiftshader WebGL. Ideally

> only GLTextureImageBackingFactory would be needed for swiftshader WebGL

> but other factories, eg. IOSurfaceImageBackingFactory, are being used

> today. Don't initialize Skia specific backing factories as a step

> towards improving things.

>

> Also fix SharedImageFactoryTests to pass in SharedContextState to avoid

> having to handle null context state.

>

> Bug: 41497046

> Change-Id: I0e6af3390ba19f208a9736c12e9ea7093915c323

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5277603

> Reviewed-by: Vasiliy Telezhnikov

> Commit-Queue: Kyle Charbonneau

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1272740}

entry.title: [css-scroll-snap-2] Switch snapchanged to updated SnapEvent interface
entry.content:
This patch makes snapchanged fire SnapEvents based on the updated[1]

SnapEvent interface which supplies exactly one snap target per axis.



We detect that the snap targets of a SnapContainerData has changed by

comparing its current target_snap_area_element_ids_ to the element ids

that were most recently used to evaluate snapchanged. This requires

that if a snap container is snapped in both axes but is then scrolled

in only one axis, it needs to remember what it was snapped to in the

other (unscrolled) axis - previously, we simply forgot what we were

snapped to in the unscrolled axis.



prefer-common-to-both-axes.html had to be modified because remembering

what we are snapped to in the unscrolled axis affects the choice of

snap targets when there is a layout change resulting in the targets

along each axis not being mutually visible. Currently, chromium handles

this somewhat arbitrarily (This will be adddressed in

crbug.com/329250094) This patch gets around this by scrolling in both

axes.



snapchanged-ensures-dom-order.html is deleted because we don't return a

list anymore so we don't need to ensure the order of the list.



[1]https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/pull/9515



Bug: 329111147

Change-Id: I4af884bd58d0517087a8c8960bf7646f3a36ba72

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5369681

Reviewed-by: Steve Kobes

Commit-Queue: David Awogbemila

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1273041}

entry.title: Reland "webnn: Enable TFLite-based WebNN service on Android and ChromeOS"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit a21a9c6f0399a795a349ecbb26fe12f71cf40ab8



The failing tests have been disabled because:

- I suspect the test itself has UB, and

- we're about to migrate these tests to WPTs anyways.

See https://crbug.com/327337526



Original change's description:

> webnn: Enable TFLite-based WebNN service on Android and ChromeOS

>

> This change expands the usage of the TFLite-based WebNN service

> implementation from Linux-only to Android and ChromeOS as well.

>

> Enabling it on Android is a necessary step for issue 41486052, which

> will leverage Android-specific TFLite delegates to access mobile ML

> accelerator hardware. As expected since this is the first change to

> enable a functional end-to-end implementation of WebNN there is a small

> binary size impact. About half of this is the Mojo bindings and the

> other is the graph validation and TFLite flatbuffer construction code.

> This is largely unavoidable. The bulk of the binary size cost has

> already been borne by the other Chrome features which originally

> introduced the TFLite dependency.

>

> Enabling it on ChromeOS is a necessary step for issue 326356909 however

> as currently implemented the instance of TFLite in the browser process

> will be used instead of deferring to the ChromeOS ML service. This can

> be handled in a follow-up CL.

>

> This change maintains the existing arbitrary rule that setting the

> deviceType to "gpu" means the WebNN service will be used instead of

> either the XNNPACK backend (or Model Loader on ChromeOS).

>

> Bug: 326356909,41486052

> Binary-Size: See commit description.

> Change-Id: Ief27b1f8ec58de78d859596b89015225a5ab993c

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5368950

> Reviewed-by: Austin Sullivan

> Commit-Queue: Reilly Grant

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1272481}



Bug: 326356909,41486052

Binary-Size: See commit description.

Change-Id: I15d6e8472cca7ad0335b60e050bfbbcd2627630b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5371964

entry.title: http mojom: represent request header values as ByteStrings
entry.content:
This change passes the value field of HttpRequestHeaderKeyValuePair as a

ByteString rather than a string. The relevant standard (RFC 7230)

defines this as basically an opaque octet string with no defined

encoding; Blink internally treats them as being either Latin-1 or UTF-16

depending on whether they came over the wire or from JavaScript.



This change also adds some documentation of the WTF::String <-> mojo

string mapping.



Change-Id: I709ca1287b4d96628c74546ac5e99019522899fd

Bug: 326376204

entry.title: Reorder precedence of Cookie Access Grants
entry.content:
This CL set precedence to allow first priority consideration of our long term solutions, to enhance visibility on their web ecosystem adoption.

Similarly, sites controlled mechanisms should be check before Chrome

ones, and user controlled mechanisms should come last as in an ideal

scenario users shouldn't need to trigger them.



The predefined and defaulted controls will always come first.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.CookieAccess.ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism2 is replaced by PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.CookieAccess.ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism3



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.TPCAccess.CookieReadStatus is replaced by PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.TPCAccess.CookieReadStatus2



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram API.StorageAccess.AllowedRequests2 is replaced by API.StorageAccess.AllowedRequests3



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram Tpcd.Mitigations.Dt.FirstParty.Deployment is replaced by Tpcd.Mitigations.Dt.FirstParty.Deployment2

entry.title: [wpt-importer] Detect new TestExpectations between any commits (3/n)
entry.content:
The `ImportNotifier` currently assumes it's on a branch representing a

successful import, and that the expectations updater will pass the added

`TestExpectations` lines. These assumptions won't hold after bug filing

moves from the end to the start of each import attempt (the last

imported CL will be some commit on `main`).



This refactor prepares for the decoupling by deriving added expectations

from the `git` history rather than the build results. This ensures the

notifier files bugs for expectations corrected by the WPT import/export

gardener, which occurs regularly.



A follow-up change will refactor new baseline detection similarly.



Bug: 40281557, 40631540

Change-Id: Id6105b71771979f9ebcbdbdd64bb3a0d908946c4

entry.title: Ensure only token origin disables trials from subdomain-matching tokens
entry.content:
This CL fixes an issue where a subdomain of some origin (i.e., the

token origin) providing a subdomain-matching token for a persistent

origin trial in an HTTP response header would overwrite all

previously persisted tokens for the token origin.



This CL explicitly ensures the following:

* A document from the origin stored in the token loaded without the

token causes the associated persisted trial to be disabled.

* A document from a subdomain of the token origin loaded without the

token does not disable the associated persisted trial.

* A subdomain-matching token provided in a HTTP response header by a

subdomain of some origin (i.e., the token origin) is appended to

the token origin's existing list of tokens.



Bug: 329046726

Change-Id: I29d5ed20f4c377566ed3e1b95fd9f985c554b18c

entry.title: [ios] When focusing the Omnibox from the NTP, stop any defocus animation
entry.content:
When the user uses a keyboard shortcut like CMD-T to create a new tab,

the Omnibox is immediately focused. But if the existing tab's omnibox

is focused, it starts a defocus animation and then animates in the new

tab and starts a focus animation. Because there is only one NTP that

is used for both the old tab and the new tab, we need to stop the

defocus animation when we start the focus animation - otherwise the

final animation and position is a race condition between the two.



This changes the defocus animation to use a UIViewPropertyAnimator (just

like the focus animation) so that it can be canceled before a focus

animation is started.



Fixed: 328398603

Change-Id: I7fb77e6cc1c92913b00b095822dda2775f27b781

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5370903

Reviewed-by: Chris Lu

Commit-Queue: Scott Yoder

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1273015}

entry.title: Multiplanar: Use ALPHA8 as fallback instead of LUMINANCE8
entry.content:
Use GL_ALPHA/ALPHA8 as fallback when GL_RED/RED8 is not available

instead of GL_LUMINANCE/LUMINANCE8. This is due to cases where

VideoResourceUpdater passes Y_U_V planar format with GL_LUMINANCE

internal formats when R8 is not available to skia but SkColorType

passed in is Alpha. Due to this incompatibility, Skia refuses to create

backend textures with this format.



This change updates the fallback format to ALPHA so its compatible with

the SkColorType and works okay.



Bug: 40276184

Change-Id: Ie7b3fce2cae679f406de5d51dc3926996cf23365

entry.title: media: Retry getting video configs if none exist for OOPVD
entry.content:
It's been observed on geralt (a new ARM device) w/ certain

configurations that the /dev/video-dec0 device isn't present initially

on startup. When using OOPVD (which is now the default), this would

cache the format detection and not retry. This adds code to retry after

a delay until it gets the supported configs. This is very hacky and just

a temporary solution until a proper one is found.



BUG=b:328092014

TEST=HW decode used on first boot of geralt

entry.title: [zlib][riscv] Add rules to enable SIMD optimizations for Arm
entry.content:
The first step to add support for RISCV is to actually proof test the

CMake buildsystem to ensure that the SIMD optimizations are actually

enabled.



Currently we only enable the SIMD optimizations in CMake while building

for x86-64 and this patch will add support for a second architecture

(i.e. Arm), opening the way for a third (RISCV).



Finally, the CPU features detection model on RISCV is similar to Arm

(i.e. calls to getauxval()) instead of simply reading a register (i.e. x86),

so it is helpful to ensure that the code will cover all three

architectures (x86-64, Arm, RISCV).



Bug: 329282661

Change-Id: I4c9774d11c583361ba93e2a9ba2e16e82c483274

entry.title: birch: Fix weather not loading sometimes on initial display
entry.content:
Loading weather requires a network request to a backend service that

requires auth tokens. Ensure that the user's refresh tokens are

available before attempting to make a weather fetch.



This requires access to IdentityManager, so plumb it from ash into

chrome via BirchClient. Add a helper RefreshTokenWaiter class. A future

CL will adapt BirchCalendarFetcher to use the waiter, since it has the

same issue with refresh tokens.

entry.content:
overlay.



This CL does the following:

1) Moves side panel resources to its own subdirectory.

Updates constants accordingly.

2) Creates a feature param for the base results search URL.

Allows framing from this URL on the WebUI as well as other

subdomains.

entry.title: ozone/drm: Retry test modesets w/ all possible CRTC-connector permutations
entry.content:
The kernel sometimes uses multiple CRTCs for a single connector without

marking the CRTC as in use to userspace. One such case is when

Bigjoiner (an intel driver feature) takes an additional CRTC for high

bandwidth modes. Modesetting with a stolen CRTC will result in failure.

The only way to work around additional CRTCs being taken is to test

modeset on various CRTC-connector permutations, and to use the

permutation that doesn’t fail.



This CL adds a fallback logic on test modeset failure.

The fallback logic generates all possible permutations of

CRTC-connector pairings given each connectors’ possible CRTCs, and

tries to test modeset on all of them. The fallback will immediately

terminate upon the first test modeset success.



Ozone will revert any changes to its abstractions that were made during

the fallback attempts, such that the original CRTC-connector pairings

before the configure request are maintained. Maintaining the original

pairings is necessary as pageflips with old display state might

interleave the UI's fallback test modesets. GetNativeDisplays()

attempts to maintain stability of CRTC-connector pairings whenever

possible, which leads to dramatically decreased chances of pageflip

failure (which results in GPU process crash).



high-bandwidth display



Bug: b:322831691, b:303194009

Test: ozone_unittests && display_unittests && manual testing w/

Change-Id: I3c747032067b2d4a2d8ab8974f59d7d2dbe53c65

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5301492

Commit-Queue: Su Hong Koo

Reviewed-by: Gil Dekel

Reviewed-by: Mark PMNKHME

entry.title: ozone/drm: Add helper to generate all permutations of CRTC/Connector pairings
entry.content:
The kernel sometimes uses multiple CRTCs for a single connector without

marking the CRTC as in use to userspace. One such case is when

Bigjoiner (an intel driver feature) takes an additional CRTC for high

bandwidth modes. Modesetting with a stolen CRTC will result in failure.

The only way to work around additional CRTCs being taken is to test

modeset on various CRTC-connector permutations, and to use the

permutation that doesn’t fail.



To facilitate test modeset with all possible permutations of

CRTC-connector pairings, this CL introduces

GetAllCrtcConnectorPermutations(), which takes in a list of connectors

and returns a list of all possible CRTC-connector pairing permutations.

The returned list will only return permutations where all specified

connectors are assigned to a CRTC.



Bug: b:322831691

be broken with forward declaration as nested classes can’t be forward

entry.title: [infra] Add documentation for the lucicfg graph.
entry.content:
The only documentation for the lucicfg graph is docstrings in the

libraries that are included by lucicfg but not actually publicized

anywhere. This adds documentation for the graph concepts and the lucicfg

library used for manipulating the graph and our own nodes library that

builds on top of it. This should hopefully ease the process of coming up

to speed with the graph code.



While trying to document the allow_unnamed parameter to

create_unscoped_node_type, it was apparent that it was mixing terms,

so it was change to allow_empty_id to more directly express the

behavior that it enables.

entry.title: ozone/drm: Add helpers to list all possible CRTC IDs for a connector
entry.content:
Implement two helpers, GetPossibleCrtcsBitmaskFromEncoders() and

GetPossibleCrtcIdsFromBitmask(), which when used together gets a list

of all possible CRTC IDs for a given connector.

GetPossibleCrtcsBitmaskFromEncoders() takes a list of encoder IDs

compatible with a connector, and returns a bitmask of possible CRTCs

for all the specified encoders. This bitmask can be passed into

GetPossibleCrtcIdsFromBitmask() to be converted into a list of CRTC

IDs.

entry.title: ozone/drm: Replace CRTCs without creating a new DrmDisplay/ScreenManager/HDC
entry.content:
The kernel sometimes uses multiple CRTCs for a single connector without

marking the CRTC as in use to userspace. One such case is when

Bigjoiner (an intel driver feature) takes an additional CRTC for high

bandwidth modes. The only way to work around additional CRTCs being

taken is to test modeset on various CRTC-connector permutations, and to

use the permutation that doesn’t fail.



Currently in ozone/drm, CRTCs and connectors are paired up when

creating various display abstractions during

DrmDevice::GetNativeDisplays() call. These pairings last throughout the

lifetime of the display configuration (until a display change udev).

There is now a need to allow changes to the CRTC-connector pairings on

every DrmDevice::ConfigureNativeDisplays().



This CL adds ScreenManager::ReplaceDisplayControllersCrtcs() and

DrmDisplay::set_crtc(), which allows ozone abstractions to swap out

CRTCs assigned to the connectors without creating new instances of

them.



Bug: b:322831691

Test: ozone_unittests

Change-Id: I10ec7b581b7018a6d040d59d50d35cec251a0bab

entry.title: Refactor AutofillPaymentMethodsFragmentTest
entry.content:
Clean up unit tests for mandatory re-auth and cvc

storage flags in AutofillPaymentMethodsFragmentTest file.

The goal is to decouple the tests pertaining these flags

since some of the existing tests create duplicates by testing

both features at the same time.



Tests to ensure coverage for mandatory re-auth instead of

the deleted code:

- UI test (flag on) -> testMandatoryReauthToggle_displayToggle (which maintains the same coverage as the deleted testMandatoryReauthToggle_displayToggle_cvcStorageEnabled)

- UI test (flag off) -> testMandatoryReauthToggle_notShownWhenFeatureDisabled



Tests to ensure coverage for cvc storage instead of

the deleted code:

- UI test (flag on) -> testSaveCvcToggle_shown

- UI test (flag off) -> testSaveCvcToggle_notShownWhenFeatureDisabled

(These two tests ensure coverage for the deleted testTwoCreditCards_displaysTwoServerCards_cvcStorageEnabled

and testMandatoryReauthToggle_notShownWhenFeatureDisabled_cvcStorageEnabled)





Fixed: 329158686

first request against Safe Browsing after startup. On mobile, we expect

entry.content:
Improves the performance of setSelectedItemPathForRoute_() from

O(k*n) to O(k + n), where k is the height of the route tree and n is

the number of menu items.

This is done in preparation for redirecting from an L1 page to an L2

page under the revamp. Also backfills test coverage.

entry.title: webui: detect when the preloaded contents is ready to show
entry.content:
A top chrome WebUI page notifies its embedder when it is ready to be

shown by calling MojoBubbleWebUIController::Embedder::ShowUI(). This

patch captures this signal in the preload manager, when the page is not

yet attached to any views.



WebUIPreloadManager::MakeContents() now returns a struct that contains

the preloaded WebContents and an "is_ready_to_show" boolean. This will

later be used in WebUIBubbleManager to skip page reloading if the page

is already ready to show.

entry.title: [ios] Do not report form activity for each removed form
entry.content:
There is an unnecessary form activity notified when there is a removed

form notified.



This is because in the old logic, we would return whenever a form

activity was found, but now we can batch up to 2 form activities, so

the code needs to handle that.



Using .forEach simplifies the comprehension of the loop, and it

represents a speed improvement as tested on

http://shortn/_LkVWu57qsr



The form activity case at the end of the loop had to be notified only

if there weren't removed form detected before.



Bug: 325415935

entry.title: Implement Safe Browsing Interstitial UKM
entry.content:
To help us accurately understand how safe browsing interstitial events

occur in relation to other events (such as users accepting notification

permissions for a site), we want to add a UKM that logs occurrences of

the two events: Safe Browsing interstitial shown and user proceeds past

interstitial. See the UKM collection doc [1] and UKM data usage

doc[2] for more details.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CRC_8zRzbAjMT7Rbfmt6cdqJLHELZzP6O9tfVlohsbs

entry.title: Mahi: Create ReadWriteCardsUiController and add Mahi view
entry.content:
Create ReadWriteCardsUiController, which creates and manages the

widget that hosts both quick answers and mahi cards shown alongside the

context menu. Right now, the controller will have the capabilities of

adding/removing quick answers/mahi views and show/hide the widget

accordingly. Widget bounds calculation will be added in the next CL.



This CL also adds the Mahi view to this widget when text is selected.



A new directory //c/b/ui/read_write_cards is also created to contain

all the logic related to ReadWriteCards, more classes from quick_answers

and editor_menu will be moved to this directory in future CLs.



Design doc: http://go/mahi-ui-dd#heading=h.4crzadrm7qmm

entry.title: [Nearby Presence] Migrate NearbyPresenceService::PresenceDevice
entry.content:
`NearbyPresenceService::PresenceDevice` (NPS::PD) was originally created

before the library representation of PresenceDevice was completed. This

change removes the usage of NPS::PD and replaces it with the Nearby

library's implementation.



Note that doing so removes the RSSI and Stable Device ID information, as

that's currently not being tracked in the library implementation. A

future CL will either re-introduce it into the library if that data is

still needed OR remove those fields from the mojom::PresenceDevice

if they are no longer needed.



Fixed: b/327278661

entry.title: Resolve percentages for relative color channels with calc()
entry.content:
Extend ConsumeRelativeColorChannel() to be able to handle additional

categories of calc() results - and . In the latter

case resolve against the base specified in the specification for each

color function.



Move per-function metadata to a table structure - containing the list of

channel keywords and the percentage bases for each channel. Use this

table to also simplify the existing resolution of percentage values.

entry.title: Log AndroidTelemetryService referrer chain metrics at ping generation
entry.content:
The AndroidTelemetryService currently observes all downloads, then only

does anything with a small fraction of them. This means that

https://crrev.com/c/5318781 began computing referrer chains for all

downloads, and logging metrics for all downloads. This is not the intent

of the metrics, so instead persist the result of referrer chain

computation so we can log it only when we decide to send a ping.



Bug: 324293877

entry.title: Introduce common SearchActivity call-up mechanism.
entry.content:
This change introduces a SearchActivityClient, a standalone interface

that permits components to call up SearchActivity.



The component allows us to provide a simple scalable solution for all

SearchActivity use cases. The intention is to migrate multiple

different invocation mechanisms to a single, easily expandable

mechanism that can encompass them all.

entry.title: Dismiss Apps Collections view context menu sorting
entry.content:
This cl allows the AppsCollections page to receive right click events.

A right click will trigger to show the AppsGridContextMenu, which allows

users to sort the regular apps grid. In the context of the Apps

Collections view, the menu will have the same elements as the regular

apps grid, but instead of snapping into and ordered AppsGridView, a

confirmation dialog will request input from the user, letting them know

that the sorting action will result in the tutorial view dismissal.



After accepting the dialog, the user will be shown the regular apps

grid, as if it was sorted by they elected choice.

entry.title: Remove Memory.System.AvailableMB histogram
entry.content:
The histogram "Memory.System.AvailableMB" is recorded every 5 secs on

Windows (http://crrev.com/c/4200608). This is causing lock contention

inside base::StatisticsRecorder::FindHistogram. We are seeing some jank

instances on UI thread, especially on low to mid range devices (RAM 2GB

to 6GB). During code review, it was pointed out that this histogram is

redundant, hence removing it.



Memory.System.AvailableMB histogram is redundant with

Memory.Experimental.AvailableMemoryMB (cross-platform) which is recorded

here: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/performance_manager/metrics/metrics_provider_desktop.cc;l=244;drc=bb3b7c5fa491b98146018d70a6e7a0b5e70be0a2

entry.title: [Default Nav Transition] Implement the UX for BeforeUnload handler
entry.content:
The UX is: as long as the browser sends out the BeforeUnload IPC to the

renderer, we play the cancel animation to bring back the active page,

even if the renderer decides to not show the prompt at all (e.g., if

the page doesn't have a sticky user activation).



In real world testing, the IPC exchange is so fast (in the case where

the renderer doesn't show the prompt and acks to proceed) that the

cancel animation never gets to play a single frame (even on a debug

build). This is close the the ideal UX mentioned below.



Ideally we want to only play the cancel animation if the renderer

decides to show the prompt. While this is a better UX, it makes the

impl complicated as we need to decide what to show after the user lifts

the finger and before the renderer asks the browser to draw the prompt.

(presumably the invoke animation, then plays the cancel animation when

the renderer acks to show the prompt).



Alternatively, we could let the browser not send out the BeforeUnload

message if we know that the renderer for sure will always ack with

proceed. RFHI::HasStickyUserActivation already has the information,

though the source of truth is passed from the renderer. However we

don't really know the complication of changing the BeforeUnload flow

so this current impl is the best option for now.



Bug: 1421009

Low-Coverage-Reason: TRIVIAL_CHANGE

Change-Id: I993faba663075f5519321d69c26afa2b26404974

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5325441
